   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Test of the pool_size option in connecting nodes with multiple
   23: %% connections.
   24: %%
   25: 
   26: -module(diameter_pool_SUITE).
   27: 
   28: %% testcases, no common_test dependency
   29: -export([run/0,
   30:          run/1]).
   31: 
   32: %% common_test wrapping
   33: -export([
   34:          %% Framework functions
   35:          suite/0,
   36:          all/0,
   37:          init_per_suite/1,
   38:          end_per_suite/1,
   39:          init_per_testcase/2,
   40:          end_per_testcase/2,
   41:         
   42:          %% The test cases
   43:          tcp/1,
   44:          sctp/1,
   45:          any/1
   46:         ]).
   47: 
   48: 
   49: -include("diameter_util.hrl").
   50: 
   51: 
   52: %% ===========================================================================
   53: 
   54: %% Config for diameter:start_service/2.
   55: -define(SERVICE(Host),
   56:         [{'Origin-Host', Host ++ ".ericsson.com"},
   57:          {'Origin-Realm', "ericsson.com"},
   58:          {'Host-IP-Address', [{127,0,0,1}]},
   59:          {'Vendor-Id', 12345},
   60:          {'Product-Name', "OTP/diameter"},
   61:          {'Auth-Application-Id', [0]},  %% common
   62:          {'Acct-Application-Id', [3]},  %% accounting
   63:          {restrict_connections, false},
   64:          {spawn_opt, {diameter_dist, route_session, []}},
   65:          {application, [{alias, common},
   66:                         {dictionary, diameter_gen_base_rfc6733},
   67:                         {module, diameter_callback}]},
   68:          {application, [{alias, accounting},
   69:                         {dictionary, diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733},
   70:                         {module, diameter_callback}]}]).
   71: 
   72: 
   73: -define(PL(F),    ?PL(F, [])).
   74: -define(PL(F, A), ?LOG("DPOOL", F, A)).
   75: 
   76: 
   77: %% ===========================================================================
   78: 
   79: suite() ->
   80:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 45}}].
   81: 
   82: all() ->
   83:     [tcp, sctp, any].
   84: 
   85: 
   86: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   87:     ?PL("init_per_suite -> entry with"
   88:         "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
   89:     ?DUTIL:init_per_suite(Config).
   90: 
   91: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   92:     ?PL("end_per_suite -> entry with"
   93:         "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
   94:     ?DUTIL:end_per_suite(Config).
   95: 
   96: 
   97: %% This test case can take a *long* time, so if the machine is too slow, skip
   98: %% init_per_testcase(parallel = Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   99: %%     ?RL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> check factor", [Case]),
  100: %%     Key = dia_factor,
  101: %%     case lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Config) of
  102: %%         {value, {Key, Factor}} when (Factor > 10) ->
  103: %%             ?RL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> Too slow (~w) => SKIP",
  104: %%                 [Case, Factor]),
  105: %%             {skip, {machine_too_slow, Factor}};
  106: %%         _ ->
  107: %%             ?RL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> run test", [Case]),
  108: %%             Config
  109: %%     end;
  110: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
  111:     ?PL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> entry", [Case]),
  112:     Config.
  113: 
  114: 
  115: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  116:     ?PL("end_per_testcase(~w) -> entry", [Case]),
  117:     Config.
  118: 
  119: 
  120: %% ===========================================================================
  121: 
  122: tcp(_Config) ->
  123:     ?PL("tcp -> entry with"
  124:         "~n   Config: ~p", [_Config]),
  125:     run([tcp]).
  126: 
  127: sctp(_Config) ->
  128:     ?PL("sctp -> entry with"
  129:         "~n   Config: ~p", [_Config]),
  130:     case ?HAVE_SCTP() of
  131:         true  -> run([sctp]);
  132:         false -> {skip, no_sctp}
  133:     end.
  134: 
  135: any(_Config) ->
  136:     ?PL("any -> entry with"
  137:         "~n   Config: ~p", [_Config]),
  138:     run([any]).
  139: 
  140: 
  141: %% ===========================================================================
  142: 
  143: %% run/0
  144: 
  145: run() ->
  146:     run(all()).
  147: 
  148: %% run/1
  149: 
  150: run(tcp = T) ->
  151:     ?PL("run(tcp) -> entry"),
  152:     connect(T, T);
  153: 
  154: run(sctp = T) ->
  155:     ?PL("run(sctp) -> entry"),
  156:     connect(T, T);
  157: 
  158: run(any = T) ->
  159:     ?PL("run(any) -> entry"),
  160:     connect(T, tcp);
  161: 
  162: run(List) ->
  163:     ?PL("run -> entry with"
  164:         "~n   List: ~p", [List]),
  165:     ok = diameter:start(),
  166:     try
  167:         ?RUN([[{[fun run/1, T], 30000}  || T <- List]])
  168:     after
  169:         ok = diameter:stop()
  170:     end.
  171: 
  172: %% connect/2
  173: 
  174: %% Establish multiple connections between a client and server.
  175: connect(ClientProt, ServerProt) ->
  176:     ?PL("connect -> start 'server' (~w) and 'client' services (~w)",
  177:         [ClientProt, ServerProt]),
  178:     [] = [{S,T} || S <- ["server", "client"],
  179:                    T <- [diameter:start_service(S, ?SERVICE(S))],
  180:                    T /= ok],
  181:     %% Listen with a single transport with pool_size = 4. Ensure the
  182:     %% expected number of transport processes are started.
  183:     ?PL("connect -> start 'server' listener with pool size 4"),
  184:     LRef = ?LISTEN("server", ServerProt, [{pool_size, 4}]),
  185:     {4,0} = count("server", LRef, accept), %% 4 transports, no connections
  186:     %% Establish 5 connections.
  187:     N = pool_size(5),  %% connections to establish
  188:     ?PL("connect -> start 'client' connections with pool size ~p", [N]),
  189:     Ref = ?CONNECT("client", ClientProt, LRef, [{pool_size, N}]),
  190:     {N,N} = count("client", Ref, pool),    %% N connections
  191:     %% Ensure the server has started replacement transports within a
  192:     %% reasonable time. Sleepsince there's no guarantee the
  193:     %% replacements have been started before the client has received
  194:     %% 'up' events. (Although it's likely.)
  195:     ?PL("connect -> sleep some"),
  196:     timer:sleep(1000),
  197:     N4 = N + 4,
  198:     ?PL("connect -> verify 'server' acceptors"),
  199:     {N4,N} = count("server", LRef, accept), %% N connections + 4 accepting
  200:     %% Ensure there are still the expected number of accepting transports
  201:     %% after stopping the client service.
  202:     ?PL("connect -> stop 'client' service"),
  203:     ok = diameter:stop_service("client"),
  204:     ?PL("connect -> sleep some"),
  205:     timer:sleep(1000),
  206:     ?PL("connect -> verify 'server' acceptors"),
  207:     {4,0} = count("server", LRef, accept), %% 4 transports, no connections
  208:     %% Done.
  209:     ?PL("connect -> remote 'client' transport"),
  210:     ok = diameter:remove_transport("client", true),
  211:     ?PL("connect -> remote 'server' transport"),
  212:     ok = diameter:remove_transport("server", true),
  213:     ?PL("connect -> stop 'server' service"),
  214:     ok = diameter:stop_service("server"),
  215:     ?PL("connect -> done"),
  216:     ok.
  217: 
  218: count(Name, Ref, Key) ->
  219:     [{transport, [[{ref, Ref} | T]]},
  220:      {connections, Cs}]
  221:         = diameter:service_info(Name, [transport, connections]),
  222:     {Key, Ps} = lists:keyfind(Key, 1, T),
  223:     {length(Ps), length(Cs)}.  %% number of processes, connections
  224: 
  225: %% Simultaneous connections are often refused on Darwin: don't try to
  226: %% establish more than one.
  227: pool_size(N) ->
  228:     case os:type() of
  229:         {_, 'darwin'} -> 1;
  230:         _             -> rand:uniform(N)
  231:     end.
